channel.title: A journey into on Bibek Panthi
channel.description: Recent content in A journey into on Bibek Panthi

item.title: Distributing chocolates to children
item.description: In how many ways can you distribute n chocolates to m children? Simplifying the condition If we consider all chocolates to be different/unique (and of course children are also unique :) ), then the first chocolate can go to any one of the n children and the next one too can go to any one of the n children and so on. This gives $ m * m * m *m.
